summary:
As a highly effective and accomplished leader with many dynamic years of positive contributions and personal achievements in game design, I am a valuable addition to any development team. I excel in challenging, deadline-driven environments where my diverse skill set can be tested and utilized to develop creative designs and solutions. I am highly motivated, innovative, detail-oriented and responsive, with a strong desire to exceed both personal and professional expectations and consistently deliver paramount results.

Highlights from my experience:

* 8+ years of game development and design experience
* Diversified skill set including level, technical, & system design, and animation & cinematic experience
* Experience in online cooperative multi-player, shooters, open world, live, and narrative content
* Innovated flexible user-friendly workflows for content creation, games systems, and live services
* Manage & advised design teams through the design process
* Empowered external partner studios through design work, documentation, and personal engagement
* Guest speaker, mentor, & professional resource on game design and development at SCAD and SMU
* 3-time GDC Narrative Summit award winner: Platinum Winner for Portal 2, Gold Winner for Homefront, and Gold Winner for Mass Effect
* Ability to promote overall vision throughout all game designs to ensure consistency
* Work collaboratively to create exciting, innovative game mechanics and scenarios
* Self-motivated, with the ability to prioritize tasks appropriately to meet deadlines
* Fast learning-curve and adaptability to master new practices and assimilate new tools and methods

Open to consulting and speaking engagements that do not conflict with my current employer.

awards.title: GDC Game Narrative Review: 2012 Platinum Winner for Portal 2
awards.description:
Every year, leading game design programs at universities across the country integrate the GDC's Game Narrative Review competition into their academic curricula. Each participating student conducts a detailed structured analysis of the narrative elements of a game title of their choice. The resulting papers are submitted to the GDC writing board for review, and the submitters with the most promising entries are then invited to create a poster as a visual synopsis of their review. Successful poster submissions are declared winners and exhibited at the GDC. 

My analysis looks at Portal 2 from the perspective of medium-specific storytelling methods and how it creates a multi-layered narrative that draws from the classical monomyth and Greek tragedies. It is this strong intertwining of story with gameplay and the medium-specific delivery methods through which the story is told that creates a narrative best told through a video game.
awards.issuer: Game Developer's Conference - Game Narrative Summit

awards.title: GDC Game Narrative Review: 2011 Gold Winner for Homefront
awards.description:
Every year, leading game design programs at universities across the country integrate the GDC's Game Narrative Review competition into their academic curricula. Each participating student conducts a detailed structured analysis of the narrative elements of a game title of their choice. The resulting papers are submitted to the GDC writing board for review, and the submitters with the most promising entries are then invited to create a poster as a visual synopsis of their review. Successful poster submissions are declared winners and exhibited at the GDC. 

My analysis looks at Homefront's depiction of racial tension and minority characters in video games. I also briefly examine how the game uses the player as a supporting character to an NPC's heroic journey.

I look at the heroic archetype as used in Mass Effect and how the game asks what it means to be a hero when surrounded by ambiguous moral, ethical, and personal responsibilities.

profile_positions.description:
As the resident designer and an leading member of the multiplayer performance team at Crystal Dynamics, I provide leadership, decision-making, and team support where necessary in addition to design-, tech-, and content-based individual contributor duties. In my role as a technical designer, I create and manage design workflows, provide embedded technical expertise, and implement features/content as needed.

The major feature I own from prototype to ship is the real-time cinematic system, associated workflows and content for Marvel's Avengers. As one of the major performance teams for the game, we were responsible for the majority of multi-player cinematics, mission briefings, and mission cutscenes. As a team, we deliver an unprecedented amount of cinematics for the game as well as establishing a method for creating such cinematics for a live service game.

I work closely with the performance director and team producers to help manage internal work, embedded team schedule/needs, and technical needs on owned features. Additionally, as an product and feature owner, I work with my counterparts at partner studios as a resource by providing feature mentorship, documentation, and content creation guidance. And as a technical designer, I internally partner with the multi-player team as an additional technical resource.
